name: pdxbyte
body:
# Welcome to pdxbyte.
A Portland Oregon users group primarily for languages that compile to machine native format such as C, C++, and Assembly. 

# Meeting format
* Beginner talk
* Short break
* Announcements
* Intermediate to advanced talk

### Beginner talk
Hello World!
A lot of experienced programmers feel like beginners with C even if they used it in school if they haven't used it extensively since then. Students, and people who might need a refresher should both feel comfortable in this part of the meeting.

### Announcements
The second part of the meeting will have a set start time such that people can skip the first talk. Announcements include telling people about projects they are looking to collaborate with, upcoming events, and "We're Hiring". 

### Intermediate to advanced talk
Could be almost anything. Starting a new hobby operating system? Programming spin control on a rocket? Writing a fast paced 3d video game? Bootstrapping bare metal via a JTAG debugger? We'd love to hear about it. 

# Location and time
The location, and time of the first meeting isn't set yet, but there is a high probability that it will be hosted at New Relic as someone from there offered already.

# Get in Touch
[Join the mailing list](https://groups.google.com/group/pdxbyte)

# Code of conduct
Don't be a jerk

# Organizers
Daniel Patrick Johnson (@teknotus) got things moving with a call for proposals on the DorkbotPDX mailing list, Thomas Lockney (@tlockney) thought of the name pdxbyte, and generously donated the domain names.

# Contribute
This page is hosted at github. Create a pull request, or ask for a commit bit.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
